intro: Echinocereus ferreirianus subsp. lindsayi, commonly known as the Lindsay's hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, spineless cactus with a globular shape and typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are followed by red, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. This subspecies is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
